Comment: Same routine King Pawn 2
He has mirrored.  I quite like that.
Protect my pawn. Ng6?
That is so he can bring his Knight out off b8 without trapping c7 pawn (He told me last time we played).
So Knight out..  Next Nc6!!
Told you.
Bishop attacks f7 and enables castling option.
Brother Dardon and I play all the time he always thinks I am after his rook.  I am guessing this is to stop my knight moving to g5 threatening the fork on f7.
This will be no surprise to him.  He knows I do this for the extra space for my bishop on a2 whilst preventing Nb4.

The trouble you get when you talk about your games is the player you talk to starts to understand your way of thinking.  I thought h6 was to protect my knight going for the fork (as he told me was a concern previously).  But instead it is to prevent......
.......me going to g5 with my bishop and taking his knight after this move    ( as I told him due to my liking for the d5 square attacked with knight on f6)
Strengthening the two pawns this also opens up his white squared bishops diagonal.
Not liking his knight protecting this square I offer knight for knight.  I am sure he knows I want it but will he accept?
After our previous discussion he chooses to refuse the knight exchange.  I do not like this move as It may harm my pawn structure in the event of exchanges.
I decide to at least take his knight.  I am not sure if he wants knight or bishop and I preferably do not want to exchange both of them.

Got my knight.  This attacks my king side of the board in the event of me castling.  Clears the path for his queenside castling.  Backs up his bishop If I decide to exchange, keeping his pawn structure in tact.

Because of the attack on my king side and the strength of his defence king side. I am going to open up the possibility of queen side castling. Bd2 protects king here for now and keeps diagonal options open.
Strange move.  Cant see what it acheives.  Perhaps wants to bring out his bishop for king side castle without making queen vulnerable.
Originally I didn't want bishop for bishop but this will open up his king slightly and tie up f7 pawn doubling it up with e5 pawn.
now e6 pawn is weak and king is open for Qh5 attack.
